IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MISSION - MONTGOMERY COALITION FOR ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY, INC. ("MCAEL") STRENGTHENS THE COUNTYWIDE ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY NETWORK TO SUPPORT A THRIVING COMMUNITY AND EFFECTIVE WORKFORCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MISSION - MONTGOMERY COALITION FOR ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY, INC. ("MCAEL") STRENGTHENS THE COUNTYWIDE ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY NETWORK TO SUPPORT A THRIVING COMMUNITY AND EFFECTIVE WORKFORCE.
IRS990.Desc: CAPACITY BUILDING: MCAEL STRENGTHENS THE CAPACITY OF ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY PROGRAMS TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY, EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE LEARNERS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED: FOR PROVIDERS: -CAPACITY BUILDING GRANTS -WORKSHOPS -TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE -NETWORKING MEETINGS -RESOURCE LIBRARY -PROVIDER E-NEWS -ONLINE TOOLS -JOB/VOLUNTEER POSTINGS FOR INSTRUCTORS: -TRAININGS -RESOURCE LIBRARY -AWARDS/STIPENDS -NETWORKING MEETINGS -INSTRUCTOR E-NEWS LIST -JOB/VOLUNTEER POSTINGS -ONLINE TOOLS

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT: MCAEL ACTS AS A CATALYST FOR COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ABOUT THE BENEFITS THAT ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY BRINGS TO THE WHOLE COMMUNITY. MCAEL IS A COMMUNITY RESOURCE AND KNOWLEDGE CENTER FOR INFORMATION ON ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY. MCAEL ENGAGES THE BROADER COMMUNITY TO UNDERSTAND LITERACY NEEDS, GARNER SUPPORT, AND PROMOTE THE 65+ PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE ENGLISH LITERACY SERVICES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: -DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS -REPORTS -PROVIDER DIRECTORY -LEARNER STORIES -PROMOTING COMMUNITY LITERACY -COALITION BUILDING -CONNECTING BUSINESSES, GOVERNMENT, NONPROFITS, AND INDIVIDUALS -LOCAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL POLICY MONITORING

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTENDED USE OF THE TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED ASSETS IS FOR THE DR. DEBBIE BHATTACHARYYA MEMORIAL FUND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN PARTNERSHIP WITH MONTGOMERY COUNTY GOVERNMENT, MCAEL OFFERS GRANT RESOURCES TO SUPPORT ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY PROGRAMS. THE OBJECTIVE OF MCAEL'S GRANTS PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE AVAILABILITY OF ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY SERVICES OFFERED TO DIVERSE POPULATIONS, AND TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THOSE SERVICES. ALL FUNDING DECISIONS ARE MADE BY A DIVERSE PANEL OF KNOWLEDGEABLE COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITH EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE IN LOCAL COMMUNITY NEEDS, NONPROFIT MANAGEMENT, ADULT ESOL AND LITERACY, AND GOVERNMENT/NONPROFIT GRANT MAKING. EACH PANELIST IS REQUIRED TO ATTEND AN IN-DEPTH ORIENTATION AND TO READ AND EVALUATE ALL PROPOSALS BASED ON A SET OF EXPLICIT CRITERIA PUBLISHED AS PART OF THE RFP. DURING THE REVIEW AND SCORING PROCESS, A SIGNIFICANT EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON DEMONSTRATING MEASURABLE OUTCOMES. THE REVIEW PANEL MEETS IN SMALL GROUPS WITH APPLICANTS TO CONDUCT INTERVIEWS AND LATER CONVENES AS A WHOLE TO DISCUSS EACH PROPOSAL AND DETERMINE FUNDING. FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS ARE APPROVED BY NON-PROVIDER MEMBERS OF MCAEL'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. MCAEL HAS A STRICT CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND RECUSAL POLICY OF REVIEW PANEL MEMBERS AND BOARD MEMBERS. ONCE GRANTS ARE AWARDED, MCAEL ISSUES LETTERS OF AGREEMENT TO GRANTEES THAT REQUIRE THEM TO COMPLY WITH CERTAIN ELIGIBILITY AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. FORMAL AND INFORMAL MONITORING TAKES PLACE THROUGH PERIODIC SITE VISITS, WORKSHOPS, AND PHONE CONSULTATIONS WITH GRANTEES. GRANTEES MUST ALSO SUBMIT BIANNUAL QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE REPORTS AND PROVIDE DETAILED INVOICES THAT ARE SIGNED TO SUBSTANTIATE ACCURACY. AT THE END OF THE GRANT YEAR, GRANTEES MUST SUBMIT A CERTIFICATION OF EXPENSES, SHOWING ORIGINAL BUDGETED ITEMS AGAINST ACTUAL EXPENDITURES. THIS ACCOUNTING MUST BE CERTIFIED BY THE GRANTEE AS A TRUE AND CORRECT REPORT.
-ONLINE TOOLS -JOB/VOLUNTEER POSTINGS FOR INSTRUCTORS: -TRAININGS -RESOURCE LIBRARY -AWARDS/STIPENDS -NETWORKING MEETINGS -INSTRUCTOR E-NEWS LIST -JOB/VOLUNTEER POSTINGS -ONLINE TOOLS
-LEARNER STORIES -PROMOTING COMMUNITY LITERACY -COALITION BUILDING -CONNECTING BUSINESSES, GOVERNMENT, NONPROFITS, AND INDIVIDUALS -LOCAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL POLICY MONITORING

MCAEL IS COMMITTED TO APPROPRIATE FISCAL OVERSIGHT BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. AS SUCH, MCAEL WORKS TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST STANDARDS IN REVIEW OF ITS INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FORM 990. EACH YEAR, PRIOR TO THE SUBMISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, A DRAFT VERSION IS SENT TO THE TREASURER FOR AN INITIAL REVIEW. THE AUDITING FIRM WILL MEET WITH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO GO OVER THE ENTIRE FORM 990 AND ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS PRIOR TO FILING. DISCUSSIONS BY BOARD MEMBERS REGARDING THE 990 ARE DOCUMENTED IN BOARD MINUTES.

MCAEL'S BOARD PRIMARILY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE THROUGH AN ANNUAL CERTIFICATION PROCESS. EACH DIRECTOR, PRINCIPAL OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS MUST ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS SUCH PERSON HAS RECEIVED, READ AND UNDERSTOOD THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY AND UNDERSTANDS THAT THE MONTGOMERY COALITION FOR ADULT ENGLISH LITERACY IS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION, THUS IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION, IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES.
THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS REVIEWED AND ADJUSTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS USING OUTSIDE DATA AND PERFORMANCE METRICS.

MCAEL MAKES ITS ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND RECENT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH OUR WEBSITE AND THROUGH THIRD PARTY WEBSITES SUCH AS GUIDESTAR. IN ADDITION, THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT MCAEL'S OFFICE AND THROUGH THE MARYLAND OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF STATE.
